questions.question: Can we talk about this being in touch with something that is more real than real?
Is it possible to figure out whether psychedelic substances are being consumed by looking at human behavior?
Can we step back and just look at your work with the book Immortality Key?
What language was used to understand wine at the time?
What role do these tools, do these pharmacons have in trying to stimulate the imagery of religion?
What is the future of religious experience, of psychedelic experience, of intellectual journeys, of facing death, running away from death?
What do you hope that looks like and what kind of ideas should we look to?
What if I give you a very complicated definition of religion, and then we talk about a more simplified?
Like, do you think there's an absolute reality that we're kind of striving towards understanding?
What do you make of the use of psychedelics to maximize the creative potential of the human mind?
Is this a crutch or is this actually an effective tool that we should explore?
Do you see this kind of interest in aliens as at all connected to your study of religion?
Aside from that- Do you think it's somehow deeply fundamental to the human experience or is it just a trick?
Are there books or movies in your life long ago or recently that had a big impact on you?
